result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders: DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison wages. Any remaining balance to be paid during the period of ES. Any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarvell Morgan Davis

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629, and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm

Filed, signed Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order.  
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.
It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, this case is assigned via Intake Calendar to Reserve Judge, Br. 02.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 10-29-2015 received and filed. (49 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.
IN SUPPORT OF SENTENCING, FILED.

Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  
AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders: DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison wages. Any remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Any unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.   Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis in court with attorney Brian Kinstler.  Defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 2 and 3. Pursuant to plea negotiations, Court orders COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Brian Kinstler in court, defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Kinstler in court, defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are waiting on DNA results.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for 09-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark S. Tishberg in court, defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Jarvell Morgan Davis in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
